Sample and study characteristics

Source: R/sample_descriptives.R
sample_descriptives.Rd

This function calculates all sample and study characteristics mentioned in the results section of the manuscript from the raw data (see read_data). The function calculates the descriptive results at the latest passed checkpoint if not determined otherwise with the `which_checkpoint` param.

sample_descriptives(raw_data, which_checkpoint = NA_integer_)

Arguments

raw_data

dataframe, all trials included in the study
which_checkpoint

integer, index of the checkpoint to use

Value

The function returns a list of descriptives.

Examples

# \donttest{
sample_descriptives(raw_data = example_m0, which_checkpoint = NA_integer_)

#> Error: `...` is not empty.
#>

#> * `..1`
#> 
#> These dots only exist to allow future extensions and should be empty.
